p: As a part of our ongoing studies of bioactive constituents from plants commonly used in folk medicine (El-Seedi et al. 2012; Al-Henhen et al. 2014; Boldbaatar et al. 2014 ) with potential use in chemical ecology research, we here present results from 11 medicinal and culinary plants originating from Egypt. We isolated the essential oils and evaluated their bioactivity against the common tick I. ricinus and identified the main chemical constituents of these essential oils using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GCâ€“MS).
